snippet: The preview of the museum’s Schiaparelli-Prada show brings out stars, designers and Tim Tebow.
abstract: Gala for the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute exhibit on the work of fashion designers Miuccia Prada and the late Elsa Schiaparelli brings out celebrities and designers. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: THE big draw of a new Costume Institute exhibition comparing the work of Miuccia Prada and the late Elsa Schiaparelli will most likely be a series of videos directed by Baz Luhrmann that imagine the two designers having a spirited conversation about, among other things, whether fashion is art. (The part of Schiaparelli is played by Judy Davis.) Given that this conversation is taking place at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, we probably already have our answer to that question.

headline.main: Costume Drama at the Metropolitan Museum
